summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Dollhouse: Season 2 Review Date: 2010/02/03 Store: Eliza Dushku (Actor), Harry Lennix (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'From creative mastermind Joss Whedon (', 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer', ') comes the stunning final season of this sexy thriller that that will reveal all the secrets and complete your collection! As', 'Dollhouse', 'continues to provide its elite clientele with "actives"--human beings imprinted with the personas of whomever the client wants them to be--its mind-altering technology spins dangerously out of control. Now, an unlikely alliance must attempt to destroy the sinister corporation behind the facade. And, as the lovely, lethal active Echo (Eliza Dushku) struggles with the memories of her past, she must unlock the deadly secret that will ultimately determine the fate of all mankind.', 'Amazon.com', 'Add', 'Dollhouse', "to the list of excellent TV shows cancelled far too soon. Of course, it's miraculous that", 'Dollhouse', 'made it to a second season at all. Television isn\'t generally receptive to complicated stories or moral ambiguity--and how else can you describe a series about people called "actives," whose minds are wiped clean so they can be imprinted with other personalities and rented out to the wealthy? As season 2 begins, former FBI agent Paul Ballard (Tahmoh Penikett,', 'Battlestar Galactica', ') has joined the Dollhouse and become the handler for Echo (Eliza Dushku,', 'Bring It On', "), the most popular active. But Ballard still hopes to bring the Dollhouse down, and when he discovers that Echo's mind is starting to accumulate a new, coherent personality, he keeps her secret and promises to help her.", "Echo's developing self began as the season's dominant story, but halfway through the season creator Joss Whedon (", 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer', ',', "Dr. Horrible's Sing-Along Blog", ") learned the show had been cancelled--so he decided to cram the events he'd planned for multiple seasons into the remaining episodes. The result is more like a zippy science-fiction novel than typical serial television. Some plot developments feel rushed, but overall the headlong pace revs up the excitement as the Dollhouse fights against its parent corporation and instigates what may be the end of civilization. The regular characters all develop in juicy ways and some actors from other Whedon series (like", 'Firefly', "'s Summer Glau and", 'Angel', "'s Alexis Denisof) get plum guest roles. The series has its weaknesses--some ideas seem clumsily grafted on from other science-fiction franchises--but the second season vastly improved upon the first, and Whedon's vivid characters and superb storytelling make", 'Dollhouse', "a pleasure to watch. The DVD extras are substantive, particularly some deleted scenes that give additional heft to the season's developments.", '--Bret Fetzer'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 0.7 x 5.4 inches; 11.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '7986241', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, AC-3', 'Release date': 'October 12, 2010', 'Actors': 'Eliza Dushku, Harry Lennix', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, Portuguese, English', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Surround), Unqualified, Spanish (Dolby Surround)', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '4'} Review Text: So often good, intriguing science fiction teases the viewer with intrigue and possibilities, then falls flat when the "resolution" is revealed. I'm thinking of the TV show "Life on Mars." Well, "Dollhouse" not only draws you along with artful mystery and suggestion, in the end it knocks your socks off with the storyline and the conclusion. I agree with another reviewer who says this show packs in more story in it's two short seasons than many shows do over five seasons (think "Lost" which is incredibly uneven in terms of actual content). This may be due in part to the one-season reprieve Josh Whedon got to continue the story - so he had to pack a lot of story in a short number of episodes. Why can't all TV be this intense?

I can't recommend this show enough if you're a fan of science fiction set in the contemporary world. For me, this is one of THE BEST sci fi shows I've ever seen. Review Title: A Story Whose Conclusion Surprises and Satisfies Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2012/11/15 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Wes Anderson'], 'Producers': ['Wes Anderson', 'Scott Rudin', 'Jeremy Dawson', 'Steven Rales'], 'Starring': ['Bruce Willis', 'Edward Norton', 'Bill Murray'], 'Studio': ['Universal City Studios Product']} Review Text: Sweet, odd story. Big-name actors in a little-publicized movie. That tells you something about the quality of the film. Endearing. If you liked the TV series "Pushing Daisies" you might like this. Similar visual effects. Review Title: Quirky movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/12/07 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Fawcett', 'David Frazee', 'TJ Scott', 'Brett Sullivan', 'Ken Girotti'], 'Producers': ['Ivan Schneeberg', 'David Fortier', 'Karen Walton'], 'Starring': ['Tatiana Maslany', 'Jordan Gavaris', 'Dylan Bruce'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} Review Text: One of the best sci fi shows ever! Really it would be a shame to classify this as only science fiction because its appeal goes way beyond that. Suspense, mystery. Storyline is intriguing, riveting. Sit down to watch an episode and completely lose yourself in this world.

It's almost impossible to believe what a fantastic actor Tatiana Maslany is. I feel like I'm watching four totally unique characters, and when an episode is over I suddenly come back to myself and remember that ONE actress is playing all these parts. Wow! Review Title: I'm Hooked, LOVE this show! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: A Monster Calls [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2017/04/22 Store: Sigourney Weaver (Actor), Felicity Jones (Actor), J.A. Bayona (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ["Liam Neeson, Felicity Jones, and Sigourney Weaver star in this visually spectacular and stunningly emotional drama. Young Conor's life takes a turn after his mother (Felicity Jones) becomes ill and he moves in with his unsympathetic grandmother (Sigourney Weaver). As an escape, Conor turns to his artwork and conjures up a 40-foot-high monster (voiced by Liam Neeson) who becomes a most unlikely ally by guiding him on a journey of courage, faith and truth that powerfully fuses imagination and reality."] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama,Fantasy', 'Format': 'Color, Digital_copy, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Toby Kebbell, Felicity Jones, Lewis MacDougall, Liam Neeson, J.A. Bayona, Sigourney Weaver', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French Canadian (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French Canadian (DTS 5.1), Spanish (DTS 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 49 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.3 x 0.45 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '43504000', 'Director': 'J.A. Bayona', 'Media Format': 'Color, Digital_copy, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 49 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 28, 2017', 'Actors': 'Sigourney Weaver, Felicity Jones, Toby Kebbell, Lewis MacDougall, Liam Neeson', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, French Canadian', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Wow! One of the best movies I've seen in a long time. I bought this because of all the great reviews, and they are right on the money. Moving, thought provoking, even mystical. It addresses raw and difficult feelings straight on. It is a story with tremendously powerful metaphors and symbols, which is always what makes story telling great. Review Title: It's all about the metaphors Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analysis reveals that this person has a strong affinity for thought-provoking science fiction and drama, preferring complex narratives that intertwine suspense, mystery, and emotional depth. Ratings consistently hover around 4.7 to 5.0, indicating a high level of satisfaction with the content's storytelling quality. The buyer exhibits a preference for works produced by notable creators, particularly Joss Whedon and films with a quirky or unique visual style, often featuring acclaimed actors.

Frequent references to tight storytelling and intricate character development suggest an appreciation for shows and films that dare to explore moral ambiguity, emotional challenges, and unexpected plot twists. The individual values high-quality production—evident in their focus on acclaimed studios and actors—while also being open to lesser-known titles that showcase a compelling artistic vision.

Price sensitivity does not appear prominent, as the consumer opts for premium formats like DVD and Blu-ray, further emphasizing their commitment to quality entertainment experiences. Overall, this indicates a passionate consumer with discerning tastes rooted in meaningful storytelling and strong character arcs, favoring impactful cinema and television that leaves them reflective.

target_interaction.title: Sorta boring...
target_interaction.text: Kind of slow and boring. Neither stars are great singers, as they weren't always in the old days. But overall  this is just so-so. Not sure what all the hoopla was about. Glad it didn't win best picture because there was no way it deserved it. Visually very attractive, but that's not enough to make a movie great.
target_interaction.title_meta: La La Land [Blu-ray + DVD + Digital HD]
description: Winner of 6 Academy Awards including Best Director for writer/director Damien Chazelle, and winner of a record-breaking 7 Golden Globe Awards, LA LA LAND is more than the most acclaimed movie of the year - it's a cinematic treasure for the ages that you'll fall in love with again and again. Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling star as Mia and Sebastian, an actress and a jazz musician pursuing their Hollywood dreams - and finding each other - in a vibrant celebration of hope, dreams, and love. NOTE: The digital code is not expired and can be redeemed. NOTE: Item does not come with slip cover.

Special Features:Another Day of Sun: They Closed Down A FreewayLA LA LAND's Great PartyRyan Gosling: Piano StudentBefore Whiplash: Damien Chazelle's Passion ProjectThe Music of LA LA LANDJohn Legend's Acting DebutThe Look of Love: Designing LA LA LANDEpilogue: The Romance of the DreamDamien and Justin Sing: The DemosLA LA LAND's Love Letter to Los AngelesRyan and Emma: Third Time's the CharmMarketing GallerySong SelectionAudio Commentary with Writer/Director Damien Chazelle and Composer Justin Hurwitz --Lionsgate
target_interaction.store: Ryan Gosling, Emma Stone  (Actor),     Damien Chazelle  (Director)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray

details.Contributor: Ryan Gosling, Emma Stone, Damien Chazelle
